# The `SafeStack` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

The <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-safestack-cpp-/safestack">SafeStack</a> pass splits the stack of each function into the safe stack, which is only accessed through memory safe dereferences (as determined statically), and the unsafe stack, which contains all local variables that are accessed in ways that we can&#39;t prove to be safe. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class anonymous_namespace{SafeStack.cpp}::SafeStack</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

The <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-safestack-cpp-/safestack">SafeStack</a> pass splits the stack of each function into the safe stack, which is only accessed through memory safe dereferences (as determined statically), and the unsafe stack, which contains all local variables that are accessed in ways that we can&#39;t prove to be safe.

Definition at line 111 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/safestack-cpp">SafeStack.cpp</a>.

Check whether a given allocation must be put on the safe stack or not.

The function analyzes all uses of AI and checks whether it is only accessed in a memory safe way (as decided statically).

### moveStaticAllocasToUnsafeStack() {#a198cdea1012ffc357c206472f62097ef}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Value &#42; anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;SafeStack.cpp&#125;::SafeStack::moveStaticAllocasToUnsafeStack (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irbuilder">IRBuilder</a>&lt;&gt; &amp; IRB, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &amp; F, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/allocainst">AllocaInst</a> &#42; &gt; StaticAllocas, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/argument">Argument</a> &#42; &gt; ByValArguments, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; BasePointer, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/allocainst">AllocaInst</a> &#42; StackGuardSlot)</>}>
Allocate space for all static allocas in <code>StaticAllocas</code>, replace allocas with pointers into the unsafe stack.

We explicitly compute and set the unsafe stack layout for all unsafe static alloca instructions.


<SectionUser title="Returns">
A pointer to the top of the unsafe stack after all unsafe static allocas are allocated.
</SectionUser>

We save the unsafe &quot;base pointer&quot; in the prologue into a local variable and restore it in the epilogue.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/safestack-cpp/#l00157">157</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/safestack-cpp">SafeStack.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

<SectionDefinition>

## Private Static Attributes

### StackAlignment {#ae047348073cd7780b9a260609ef24488}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Align anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;SafeStack.cpp&#125;::SafeStack::StackAlignment = Align::Constant&lt;16&gt;()</>}
  labels = {["constexpr", "static"]}>
Unsafe stack alignment.

Each stack frame must ensure that the stack is aligned to this value. We need to re-align the unsafe stack if the alignment of any object on the stack exceeds this value.

16 seems like a reasonable upper bound on the alignment of objects that we might expect to appear on the stack on most common targets.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/safestack-cpp/#l00130">130</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/safestack-cpp">SafeStack.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
